properties.title: How to restrict access to your Openmeetings server
properties.author: Apache OpenMeetings Team

section.name: Server Side

section.name: Client Side
section.p: And you can restrict the access also for the client side: Every Flash Plugin will check a file called "crossdomain.xml" before it tries to access the server using rtmp/RPC. This file is located:
section.source: <?xml version="1.0"?> <cross-domain-policy> <site-control permitted-cross-domain-policies="all"/> <allow-access-from domain="localhost" to-ports="20-65535"/> <allow-access-from domain="*.local" to-ports="20-65535"/> </cross-domain-policy>
section.p:
If you accessing your application behind an Apache Webservre (using mod_proxy or mod_jk2) be careful to make the crossdomain.xml accessible. Flash will always search for this file in the www-root directory of every URL you connect to. You might use FireBug
for example to lookup requests.
